Value.title: Allow world readable logs
Value.description: World readable logs are never allowed in strict hardened configurations but are common on desktops.
Value.question: Are world readable logs allowed?

Rule.title: Check permissions of the log files

description.xhtml:p: Log files must have a permission of 0644 (if world readable logs are enabled) or 0640 (if not).
Improper file permissions could allow tampering with system logs.

Rule.fix:
ENABLE_WORLD_READABLE="<sub href="xccdf_org.open-scap.sce-community-content_value_services_logs-allow_world_readable" />"
EXPECTED_PERMISSION=0640 if [ $ENABLE_WORLD_READABLE -eq 1 ] then EXPECTED_PERMISSION=0644 fi
LOGFILES="/var/log/wtmp 664 /var/log/btmp 600 /var/log/lastlog $EXPECTED_PERMISSION /var/run/utmp 664 /var/log/messages $EXPECTED_PERMISSION"
while read name perm do [ -e $name ] || continue
chmod $perm $name done <<_EOF $LOGFILES _EOF

Rule.title: Check owner of the log files

description.xhtml:p: Log files should be owned by root.
Improper file permissions could allow tampering with system logs.

Rule.fix: chown root /var/log/wtmp chown root /var/log/btmp chown root /var/log/lastlog chown root /var/run/utmp chown root /var/log/messages

Rule.title: Check group-owner of the log files

description.xhtml:p: Log files should be group-owned by root (for lastlog and messages) or utmp (for wtmp, btmp and utmp).
Improper file permissions could allow tampering with system logs.

Rule.fix: chgrp utmp /var/log/wtmp chgrp utmp /var/log/btmp chgrp root /var/log/lastlog chgrp utmp /var/run/utmp chgrp root /var/log/messages

Rule.title: Check owner of audit log files

description.xhtml:p: All audit logs must be owned by root.
Failure to give ownership of system audit log files to root provides the designated owner and unauthorized users with the potential to access sensitive information.

Rule.title: Check permissions of audit log files

description.xhtml:p: All audit logs must be only writable by their owners and readable by the group-owner.

If a user can write to the audit logs, audit trails can be modified or destroyed and system intrusion may not be detected. System audit logs are those files generated from the audit system and do not include activity, error, or other log files created by application software.
